snippet: Researchers have found that the shape of the lure evolves depending on what kind of food is available.
abstract: Niclas Kolm study in journal Current Biology discusses ornamental lures exhibited by male freshwater fish, the swordtail characin, to tempt females; study reports that lures, which extend from the male and look like food, evolve depending on the kind of food available in the local environment.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have found that the shape of the lure evolves depending on what kind of food is available.

headline.print_headline: Fish Adjusts Its Shape To Lure Hungry Females
headline.seo: Fish’s Lure to Tempt Females Evolves Based on Available Food
headline.main: Fish Adjusts Its Shape to Lure Hungry Females
